p: The sodium-dependent serotonin transporter terminates the action of dopamine through its high affinity sodium-dependent reuptake into the presynaptic terminal, and dopamine can be regulated in cognitive-motor and other behaviors related to arousal. HTR2A and HTR3A are two of the several different 5-hydroxytryptamine (serotonin) receptors. Serotonin neurons can project fibers along the midline of the brainstem to the basal forebrain, thalamus, hypothalamus, and other regions, affecting sleep awakening and eye opening. Serotonin promotes arousal and inhibits rapid-eye-movement (REM) sleep [ 32, 33].
